IBm0ACTQ6jTvmiiv0sTXqw.text: Great flavors, very nice service, reasonably priced. An easy walk from Paddington, or take the bus and be there in minutes.

ZBc919dyHB0JekwXAxn6DQ.text: What a hidden gem !  We let the waiter pick our food and he did a great job. Starting with the papadum, everything was filled with flavor. The sizzling chicken had a bit of a kick. Prawn masala had almost a mole sauce. Great lamb,lemon rice, and garlic nan. Dinner for 3, including 2 beers £42!  We will return

wa6HLKu4ZQfVpOwma33wKg.text: What a lovely dining experience we had with Bengal!  I had read the Yelp reviews, and since we're staying in Paddington, I thought we should try it.  So glad we did!  I had made reservations on-line (only 45 minutes beforehand), and called to let them know that we were running a few minutes late.  They hadn't received the reservation on-line, but even though the place was packed upstairs, they opened the entire downstairs up for us to honor the reservation.  We had a delicious meal.  My son gobbled down his Tandori Chicken.  My husband loved his Lamb Vindiloo (sp?).  And I really liked the chicken with the rich Almond sauce (can't remember what it was called) - which was very thick and slightly sweet, but quite tasty.  We all loved the cheese naan (and all agreed it was much better than the plain).  The service was excellent.  A really nice find!

LZns3L4U5HDnpDfctH_KgQ.text: It is a small restaurant. Food was good but nothing exceptional. It is quite cheap: 1 bottle of wine, 1 starters, 2 main courses, bread/rice and dessert for 30£.

OO8Bf36ceYcp38_8CJHFjA.text: Best indian restaurant in Bayswater, its been in the area for years and has always been this good. Its really reasonably priced and the food is always perfect! The service is excellent too!

YdUdoa1m2GVZ4ohsmuoQ_g.text: The best Indian in the area. The curries are fabulous, the service is excellent and no matter how much you eat the bill will be super cheap. Best of all The Bengal Kitchen has a knack of always being full, however having a table big enough for you and your friends.

HIO41UEltibNRJh3kP23hQ.text: the bengal is one the finest food mouth watering dish i have ever had an would go back time an time again.. its based in a quite an family zone area which is good for people with children or anyone else ..their also a big space down stairs for anyone that wants to hold a party venue or birthdays are more then welcome but the main thing is there outstanding indian food which will keep you coming back for more , the bengal has had a feiw known faces coming in ie the likes of MP caron bock an many more this should tell you that the bengal indian restaurant is a trusted palce for you to eat an enjoy your self...

photos.caption: Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

QNDmpdVmVBSGnpW9TE-QZA.text: wonderful place to have a nice meal. everything is always fresh & tasty

MInKEFo6dJIiJhJds69Wuw.text: Nice food @ an even nicer price. That sums up "The Bengal" forya. Nice, cosy n quiet place that serves good curries, Bangladeshi style. The only hitch however is that the food is not authentic Indian and is more of a curry joint. I somehow find Masala Zone (especially the one at Earl's Court) and Mela closer to authentic Indian food. Having said that, cannot take the credit from Bengal for serving tasty food at honest to earth prices. They have a "lunch box" deal that serves rice and curry for 5 quid and is a steal.

D4BJfnge68qvAKvg8ajh4A.text: great food, lovely atmosphere. reasonably priced. will be back again soon with moire friends!! july 21 2012- just broke our fast here, the mixed starter was a real treat, and the dishes bursting with flavour.. all vip's in london for olympics, this is the curry joint for you!!!

_KR6f_dzhUs_qpteevHM5Q.text: Excellent food for very reasonable price. The service is very good. The chicken Tika is very very tasty.

OgVRnbc3u2yt3weMM8mVcw.text: Since my stay in HK I've become a big fan of Indian food!Unfortunately we have only few Indian restaurants in Germany, so I was glad to be in the UK being able try again great Indian food á la butter chicken etc. I tried 4-5 different restaurants, most of them located in Soho and rated with 4 to 4,5 stars and was actually a bit disappointed since it just didn't taste as good as in HK. I'm now happy that I've finally found Bengal Tiger because the food is great and the people are nice! I can especially recommend the chicken saag, in which they use a good mix of different spices, which harmonise well! Moreover the naan is super fresh. It always comes directly out of the oven! Therefore definitely worth a visit!

IQ9Hp9oIbiHb5otIRbOwkQ.text: Superb food. We had a large party, and they accommodated very quickly. We all could not get enough of the buttered chicken. Great friendly service.  Great value.

rOxj-7SYKKzDdOcQJOQgkQ.text: Astonishingly good.  Great service.  Feels cramped upstairs, but there is a full dining room downstairs as well.  The lemon rice.... OMG the lemon rice!  And the lamb vindaloo.  You will find all of your usual Indian favorites.  Seems to be popular with the locals.  Child friendly.  I was in town for 4 nights and I ate there twice - that's how good it is.

FTmB0uFluo3wzPIc8YFV5A.text: OMG.  The food here is *amazing*.  The lamb samosas are so light and flaky, and the lamb filling so tasty, that it seems a shame to use the minted yogurt with them but it was awesome!  Philip said that was the best prawn biryani he'd ever had and my sizzling dish of lamb with vegetable curry was one of the most delectable things I've ever eaten.This is the sort of place that when you're in town, you make it a special point just to go.  I may live 4200 miles away (a tad bit outside their delivery area) but when we're in London again this will be the first restaurant we visit.Aside from the food, the little place is charming, beautifully appointed, and the staff super friendly.  Couldn't ask for a better dining experience!

USQsBYdwkdP_tCqVD6g8kA.text: For the first time Yelp really let me down. Six of us went to dinner on Sunday evening. We had to sit in a poorly furnished and dimly lit basement. Not really a very comfortable location. The food was promptly served and okay, but I've had better Indian meals in London. Even the food that was said to be spicy actually was rather bland. After dinner we wanted espresso or latte macchiato but we could only order coffee or tea. The coffee which was served was by far the worst cup of coffee I've ever encountered in my life. At 40 pound at head the meal was overpriced, even for London standards. I certainly will never come here again.

3fBL8W_dRTKHbg618yB9Kw.text: I came to this place because it got great reviews and was a short distance from where we were staying. I was not disappointed! The food was the best Indian food I have ever had. The servers were friendly, attentive. The food came quickly and was a reasonable price. Delicious dishes! My only regret is that I had not found it sooner or I would have ate here twice! Delicious, don't miss out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

QnwhkEZm9PFo_zP3cHNOzQ.text: Great food and service.  Not even feeling bad about forgetting to show the 10% off coupon.

k4U3FVlg3-mf_07ql-B7EA.text: Amazing. Came here alone seeking a solid London Indian food experience and was blown away. Chicken special sizzler was to die for and I had leftovers for the next day's lunch. Classy and attentive service. Large glasses of wine poured. Great all around, would come back

MIMLq8L8AT2l9wXUXEvibQ.text: Awesome food! Best curry I've had. I asked for hot chicken curry and they definitely came through! Would recommend to anyone looking for some good food in the area.

LDo93xSkmXaOu13pEZTw0w.text: Not sure why other reviews are high. We eat Indian most cities we visit. This was subpar. Service was average. The food was bland or oddly flavored. Dahl was runny. Disappointing.

aFIo9NRYbR3101b7P0VSnQ.text: The food was a different taste then I am used to. Probably from a different region of India. It was awesome food and very reasonable price. Recommended for a quick, cheap meal.

6wi9dzFqlHGgH3T-CiZc8A.text: Excellent service. The specialties were delicious; mixed grill, lamb and chicken. The onion starter was tasty.

3ZJ2YOS7fSHJBCJTuNfcww.text: Great Indian spot. We ordered the mixed platter and shrimp vindaloo curry. Would definitely come back again! Great value!

6KxkGRzt6usQ_T7izS8Xrg.text: Went on yelp to find a new Indian Food place near a tunnel stop. Found the reviews and checked it out.The table ordered:Chutney (ok at best)Mixed Grill (Good choice)Chef's Special Lamb (ok at best)Overall, the food quality was decent especially considering the price. It is by no means great food but if you are looking for an affordable option near a local station, it's an ok option. The service was polite and helpful but pushy when it came to ordering certain dishes. We got pressured into the Special Lamb which didn't end up being that great. The food lacked the the spice and flavor which I am used to but that could be a plus for some customers.

MCblU0fdB-Wv11DCGlpuDQ.text: Was I surprised to find that the restaurant with the best Indian reviews in the area was just around the corner from me! I've walked past it almost every day and had no idea of this gem. Delicious food and excellent and most friendly service!! The 5 of us shared dishes, naan, and rice, (and good cheap bottles of house wine) and were extremely satisfied with it all. My friend asked for a take out menu (they do free delivery with orders over £12 too), and not only did they provide us with that, but sweetly gave us magnets and a giant calendar too. Will definitely be back a lot.

0PcTsrgzHnR3VfMbGiSl2A.text: You will not be disappointed.  While there are Indian restaurants with a more delicate balance of flavors in the curries, I found each dish to be dominated by its prime flavor, I was very satisfied at the conclusion of the meal, especially for the price paid.I recommend the sheek kebab which is served sizzling on a cast iron plate and with delicious grilled onions.

nPDbuR0hgYvuHJMbGNjneQ.text: We almost missed this gem as the hours were listed incorrectly on Yelp.  Am I ever glad we ventured over here from our hotel near Paddington Station.  This was by far the best Indian food I've EVER had!  Disclaimer:  I'm grew up a mid-western American girl from Indiana (not to be confused in any way with India) and my exposure to Indian food has been limited to my new home in Southern California, which may or may not be authentic.We were only in London a few nights, but made it a point to make a second trip to this restaurant and overindulge.  The papadum appetizer with sauces was brilliant.  We had a variety of dishes:  korma, plain tikka chicken, tikka masala, butter lamb and chicken, and saag paneer.  Everything was fabulous.  My 8 and 9 year old boys powered through everything.I had a brain fart and accidentally tipped over 20%, instead of what I'd researched was the local standard of 10%.  Considering how much we'd ordered, it was not insubstantial.  It was the first time we'd ever had wait staff shake our hands as we left a restaurant.We may have left a few grains of rice, but by the time we rolled out of there, realizing I'd likely never be back, the thought of moving to London briefly crossed my mind.

JKpXVKs9kIaiaD2DklnnQw.text: Nothing special... went here based on all the reviews.  Had the Bindhi bhai and it was dry as was my companions tandoori.Wouldn't make a special trip to get there.

2YcAif4u4i-SVxskxJ99oQ.text: The food was excellent!  We were greeted in a friendly manner and seated promptly upon entering. The restaurant was always full the entire visit.  The tikka Marsala was amazing with the perfect amount of spice for my pallet.  The Lamb Butter Punjab Rogan melted in my mouth and was by far the best dish we ordered.  I would recommend this to any of my friends as it is a great value for the money.

_ELqbcy5NIyGhp1Ps58zog.text: Great indian dishes for a very fair price! The waiters are very kind and polite. I ordered the Thali plate, which was quite perfect. I would definitely recommend it!Hier bekommt man gutes indisches Essen für einen fairen Preis. Die Kellner waren sehr nett und höflich. Ich hab mir die Thali Platte bestellt, die wirklich wirklich gut war und ich definitv weiterempfehlen würde. Die Toiletten waren auch sauber, das Ambiente ist recht schlicht. Die Anbindung mit dem Bus war in Ordnung.

photos.caption: Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Thali plate

6sk2OiC5Y639mI42b1Dwtw.text: I recently visited this restaurant again after one year away from the UK and found my favorite dishes ( tandoori , king prawn chili garlic curry as well as vindaloo Madras and Bhuna curries ) still as delicious as ever . I was however a bit perturbed that there were not many customers and therefore wonder why. One explanation is that food trends seem to be changing and not many people are now familiar with the real hard core Bengali/ Bangladeshi dishes any more. One thing I suggested to the owner is to not use tin prawns and always use king prawns and charge a little bit more which would make such a difference to the taste and quality. I have now departed this great city and am looking forward to visiting the Bengal again next year

OET3O-4ZvX5zyRFFzAD_GQ.text: Nice small Indian restaurant with great and affordable Indian food. Good service!Great chicken tikka marsala and puri bread.

8xb58NmT7lo_3R5h2bwbkA.text: Indian isn't my preferred choice when ordering in, but the hubs loves it so I acquiesce and we end up eating it every week or so.  That said, Bengal serves up some pretty tasty curries and they arrive piping hot.  You can't really go wrong with any of the chicken dishes but I like the spicy madras curry in particular.  The saag paneer is also great.  I'm docking one star for their naan though because it's inconsistently good...sometimes it's charred and hard, other times it's deliciously fluffy and soft. Overall a nice option if you like Indian food.

3rkMToSamUEunDk9lEMJxA.text: Ordered the Tikka Masala, Tandoori Shrimp ... and it was amazing!!! Enjoyed the food. Enjoyed the service! Although Yelp states that you can get a complementary coffee or tea with a check in, you cannot -- the restaurant said that they no longer honor it (buuuuuut they honored mine tonight because they wanted to make me a happy customer!!!). Overall, I enjoyed the food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Tikka Masala. Tandoori Shrimp. Garlic Naan. Rice (not batsmati but it will suffice). And Green Salad.
Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

gD2EYjkoB_MPYhosOCSSYw.text: This is a great neighborhood curry shop! Wonderful food and service!! Great selection of beer and cocktails.

GRM0A1NNesxIWBb9JbcWRw.text: The butter curry was way too sweet! It felt like eating tablespoons of sugar in a paste. We also did not enjoy the Keema Nan! Overall it was a waste of our money and time.

h8BPSey4_0paVs2-EqYy3g.text: We went here for dinner.  We had the Lamb Korma and the Buttered Chicken.  Both were very good.  The service was superb.  The place is in an unsuspecting area near the Royal oak train station.  It was a small charming restaurant but well patronized as the place eventually got full on that evening.  Highly recommended.

y271pOJHFbf_FlLKdQPU3g.text: amazing indian food and great service.  bookmarked this place for next time i'm in london! the owner and brother were super helpful in picking the right dishes for us!  highly recommend and they are open late too!

yC5BrQRgZOA6pvT3IuVEkg.text: I really wanted to try some Indian food in London because I heard it is amazing and Bengal Restaurant fulfilled my craving! Mind you, I am from America so I wanted to try it out. I went here with 13 other people and I saw it had really good reviews so we went for dinner. The service was amazing, especially Fazi who helped us tremendously. The food was delicious and I recommend sharing the dishes with people because they are pretty big portions for just one person. Everything was yummy and flavorful! If I ever come back to London, I will be visiting again. :)

Oj8P9CB9PYIz9a6phcuC4g.text: Found this via Yelp (obviously!) while feeling peckish in the area. £16.50 for the whole meal of tandoori lamb starter (nice), chicken tikka main course (juicy but somewhat lacking in taste/spices), naan (ok) and a large beer (well lager is a lager...). Not the best Indian I've encountered in London but quite all right nevertheless. It's a small place, had few others at 6:30pm on Monday. Service was very quick and friendly. Would I return? Yeah, value for money was good even though it was not a full five star experience as such

photos.caption: Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

zOJYvUlp1F0VfiIYHbuJew.text: Excellent Food and service, the best butter chicken I have ever had. Very nice waiter great price as well!

2Ow74H7I8qnh0e5aA02L8w.text: This should be a 3.5 star review, but going to 4 doesn't seem right.  It's a pretty small room and (during my visit) the waiters hover in a slightly disconcerting way--until you want a check, of course--but the food was fine.  And the prices are fair.  I'd recommend not getting the mixed grill--not that it was bad, but undoubtedly you'll like some of the items more than others and then just wish you had ordered the ones you liked instead of the full melange.

X1czX82X0emimfK2LpOTPQ.text: Stopped in for lunch after reading positive reviews on here and was pretty disappointed.  I wouldn't say that the food is bad, there just isn't very much that makes it special. For the price, I was expecting a lot more flavor -- and, unfortunately, the restaurant just couldn't deliver. To start, I got the lamb samosas. These were really disappointing. There was hardly any filling in them. The filling was pretty good, but this was mostly just fried dough.  For my entrée, I got the chicken tikka masala and some plain rice. The chicken was cooked really well and was actually very soft. However, the dish was lacking in the flavor department. I know tikka is not supposed to be overwhelmingly spicy, but mine just tasted very bland. More spice, less tomato would have been nice. Overall, not my favorite. The meal was okay, but there are many better options nearby that I would check out first.

wt1-A38Rkxai96yv61yhIA.text: Great real indian food. Not comercial.the real thing. Good price. Highly recomanded.Definitely the best idian we tasted in London

oxCCXD0xBEtN5BXedvTWCg.text: Food was all over satisfying: papadums were good, bengal chicken and vegetable sauce were the highlights. Chana masala and garlic nan were just plain and not very tasty. Portions were good and the food reasonably priced. Service was good. This dinner experience still left something to be desired though.

iZIyydRY_Sw4wf0N3o9ebw.text: Bengal is a cute little Indian restaurant just off Royal Oak tube. It is near my house so we have visited several times and I have to say I like it even more than Khan's. The reason for this is that the food is on the same level but they have nicer staff who are usually able to recommend you good meal or adjust it how you like it. Last time I went they made our food saucier than it was supposed to be :) Another reason is that they serve alcohol here.Check out their new lunch deal with a starter and main course for (I believe) 6 pounds.

HUNPHraIF_80nnwZDlMroQ.text: This is my 1st time in London and was craving authentic Indian food. The concierge at my hotel highly recommended this place. Although I had a nice 2 mile walk through libfins beautiful neighborhoods to this cafe. Simply said my expectations were exceeded by the warmth of my server and the high quality if delicious food.

zdGAKH5erK3DG8U1sWHOOA.text: I've heard great things about Indian food in London so when my friend and I were looking for a place to eat near the notting hill area, we found this place. It's pretty tiny, tucked into the street so you may not notice it too much when you walk by. The staff was very friendly and made good recommendations when we asked for it.The great thing for me was that they had a wide selection of vegetarian food (which is often vegan if it doesn't have cheese or butter). I asked for a recommendation and ordered the vegetable naga bhuna, which was a spicy veggie stew with a bunch of vegetables like eggplant, cauliflower, potatoes, chickpeas etc. I loved that it was actually spicy and it went great with some jasmine rice. My friend ordered a butter chicken with chapati and she said that was delicious too. Service was quite fast and I thought the food was really authentic and very affordable (by London standards). For my first Indian food experience in London, Bengal didn't disappoint.

yP285fgHpip6UoJds48TaQ.text: The food tastes great. And you know what, the boss is quite nice. I didn't order the drinks, he kindly gave me a water for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The food tastes great. And you know what, the boss is quite nice. I didn't order the drinks, he kindly gave me a water for free.
Photo of Bengal Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. The food tastes great
